property.name: ServletOutputStreamBufferSize
property.short_description: Default buffer size of the client response stream used in servlets and JSPs.
property.description: Specifies the buffer size of the servlet output stream in bytes. Because of pooling, it is recommended to restart the service after value changed.

property.name: DestroyTimeOut
property.short_description: Servlet destroy timeout.
property.description: Specifies a time period (in milliseconds) for a servlet to finish its destroy method. After this timeout, the Web container forcefully destroys the servlet instance.

property.name: JavaEncoding
property.short_description: Java file encoding to use for generating java files for JSPs
property.description: Specifies the Java file encoding for generating JSP java files.

property.name: CompileOnStartUp
property.short_description: Flag for JSP compilation
property.description: Specifies whether to compile JSPs on application startup. If set to false, a JSP file is compiled upon first request to it.

property.name: InternalCompiler
property.short_description: Flag for internal compiler usage.
property.description: If it is set to true, the system uses com.sun.tools.javac.Main for JSP compilation. It needs the tools.jar JDK library (located in the 'JDK_directory'\lib directory) to be added to the server's classpath.

property.name: ExternalCompiler
property.short_description: External compiler
property.description: Specifies the external compiler used for JSPs compilation.

property.name: JSPDebugSupport
property.short_description: Enables support of JSP debugging (JSR-045)
property.description: When set to true debug information is inserted into the generated class file - SMAP and variable debug info.

property.name: PoolSize
property.description: Defines the size of the pool of objects used for handling client requests and responses. The values are given in format {minPoolSize, maxPoolSize, decreaseCapacity}

property.name: EnableChunkedResponse
property.short_description: Flag for enabling/disabling 'chunked' HTTP response encoding.
property.description: Determines whether chunked transfer coding is applied to responses generated by servlets or JSP pages.

property.name: HeaderForNoCompression
property.short_description: NoCompression header.
property.description: Specifies the name of the header that, if present in the response message, prevents the response from being compressed using gzip transfer encoding.

property.name: HeaderForCompression
property.short_description: Compression header.
property.description: Specifies the name of the header that, if present in the response message, forces gzip compression of the response.

property.name: MultipartBodyParameterName
property.short_description: Multipart parameter name.
property.description: Specifies the name of the multipart request body attribute.

property.name: ApplicationStoppedFile
property.short_description: File for 'Application stopped' responses.
property.description: Specifies the absolute path to the custom HTML page that must be returned to the client if the requested web application is currently stopped.

property.name: ResolveHostName
property.short_description: Flag for controlling the resolving of the remote host's name.
property.description: Determines if the Web Container attempts to resolve the remote host's address when the getRemoteHost() method of the ServletRequest is called. The value of false means that the above method will return the IP address of the remote host instead of its fully-qualified host name

property.name: SuppressXPoweredBy
property.short_description: Flag for configuring usage of X-Powered-By header.
property.description: Specifies whether the Web container should suppress the usage of X-Powered-By header or not. If set to true, the Web container will not add the X-Powered-By header to the generated response. If set to false, the Web container will add the X-Powered-By: Servlet/2.5 JSP/2.1 header in the response.

property.name: DisableDynamicResponseCaching
property.short_description: Enables/disables additional headers that prevent responses generated by dynamic resources (for example, servlets or JSPs) from being stored in client caches.
property.description: The 'Cache-control: no-cache' and 'Pragma: no-cache' headers are added to responses generated by dynamic resources if the property is set to true. If set to false, headers will not be set. This property is ignored if the application explicitly sets any of the: Pragma, Cache-Control or Expires headers to the generated response.

property.name: WebContainerExtensionsProviders
property.description: This property specifies Web Container Extensions Providers manifesting their availability to the Web Container Service. Format of the property is as follows: {{WCE provider's name1, descriptor1.xml, descriptor2.xml ...}, {WCE provider's name2, descriptor3.xml ...}, ...}

property.name: ProductionMode
property.short_description: Flag that controls the Web container behavior in case of update in JSP files.
property.description: When the property is set to true, the Web Container will not recompile the JSP in case the JSP file has been modified. When set to false, any changes in the JSP file would trigger recompilation of the corresponding servlet implementation class for this JSP.

property.name: SessionProlongation
property.short_description: Flag that controls the session prolongation check by the Web Container.
property.description: When the property is set to true, the Web Container will check whether there is a need for session prolongation. When set to false, the Web Container will not trigger session prolongation check.

property.name: SessionIPProtectionEnabled
property.short_description: Flag that controls the session IP protection enabled by the Web Container.
property.description: When the property is set to true, the Web Container will enable session ip protection that is a session cannot be accessed from different IPs. Only requests from the one that initially stared the session are processed. When set to false, the Web Container will not trigger session ip protection. A session can be accessed from different IPs.

property.name: SessionIdRegenerationEnabled
property.short_description: Flag that controls the regeneration of the security session identifier enabled by the Web Container.
property.description: When the property is set to true, the Web Container will regenerate the security session identifier on every login. When set to false, the Web Container will not trigger regeneration of the security session identifier.

property.name: SecuritySessionIdDomain
property.short_description: Enables custom configuration of the cookie used for security session identifier.
property.description: Specifies the domain of the cookie used for security session identifier. Possible values: NONE - no domain attribute will be set, the cookie will be valid on the requested host only. sessionCookie - the domain attribute will be copied from the session cookie's domain configuration. The default value is sessionCookie.

property.name: ApplicationStoppedAliases
property.short_description: 'Application stopped' aliases.
property.description: Specifies a list of application aliases of web applications deployed on the current server process. If an alias appears in this list, then the corresponding web application cannot be requested (an �application stopped� response is returned to the client). The aliases in the list are separated by commas.

property.name: UseRequestObjectsPool
property.short_description: Enables usage of pooled Request and Response objects
property.description: When the property is set to true the service will use pooled Request and Response objects, otherwise a new Request and Response objects will be created for each incoming client request.

property.name: Error500MonitorsCleanupPeriod
property.short_description: Specifies the time interval in seconds at which the ISE 500 web monitors are regularly cleared.
property.description: Specifies the time interval in seconds at which the ISE 500 web monitors are regularly cleared. By default ISE 500 web monitors are emptied every 24 hours since the first Internal Server Error 500 is detected. If the value is equal to or less than 0, the cleanup operation of ISE 500 monitors is disabled. In order to trace the contents of the monitors just before they are emptied, enable 'com.sap.engine.services.servlets_jsp.Service' trace location in DEBUG severity.

property.name: path
property.description: Specifies the path to which the session cookie is set. The possible values for this element are: 1. APPLICATION - the Web Container will set the path value to '/' + alias-name + '/' 2. NONE - the Web Container will not set a path attribute 3. Custom specified string - the Web Container will use this string for path value. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default path of the session cookie is '/'.

property.name: domain
property.description: Specifies the domain of the session cookie. It can be: 1.SERVER - the Web Container will set a domain value as the host name from the request 2.NONE - the Web Container will not set a domain attribute 3.Custom specified string - the Web Container will use this string for domain value. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default domain of the session cookie is NONE.

property.name: max-age
property.description: Specifies the lifetime of the session cookie, in seconds. It must be a positive integer, if the value of the element is negative or equal to 0, the cookie will never expire. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default max-age of the session cookie is -1, that is, the lifetime value is not set.

property.name: path
property.description: Specifies the path to which the application cookie is set. The possible values for the parameter are: 1. APPLICATION - the Web Container will set the path value to '/' + alias-name + '/' 2. NONE - the Web Container will not set a path attribute 3. Custom specified string - the Web Container will use this string for path value. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default path of the application cookie is '/'.

property.name: domain
property.description: Specifies the domain of the application cookie. It can be: 1.SERVER - the Web Container will set a domain value as the host name from the request 2.NONE - the Web Container will not set a domain attribute 3.Custom specified string - the Web Container will use this string for domain value. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default domain of the application cookie is NONE.

property.name: max-age
property.description: Specifies the lifetime of the application cookie, in seconds. It must be a positive integer, if the value of the element is negative or equal to 0, the cookie will never expire. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default max-age of the application cookie is -1, that is, the lifetime value is not set.

property.name: sessionTimeout
property.description: Defines the default session timeout interval for all sessions created in this Web application. The specified timeout must be expressed in a whole number of minutes. If the timeout is 0 or less, the container ensures the default behavior of sessions is never to time out. If not specified and if the global web descriptor is not customized the default timeout period of the application cookie is 30.

property.name: location
property.description: This property specifies the component that is responsible for global error handling.

property.name: context_root
property.description: This property specifies the web application that provides the component responsible for global error handling.

property.name: maxSessions
property.description: Defines the maximum number of user sessions to an application. If the value is negative or equal to 0 no limitations for the number of sessions are applied. If not specified and if the global web-j2ee-engine descriptor is not customized the default maximum number of sessions is -1, that is the number of user sessions to an applications is unlimited.

property.name: EnableQoSRestrictionsForRD
property.short_description: Switches on/off qos restriction at request dispatcher
property.description: Switches on/off qos restriction at request dispatcher

property.name: RDThreadCountFactor
property.short_description: Defines the factor for calculating the maximum number of requests which can aquire(include/forward) a resource(alias) at request dispatcher
property.description: The maximum number of requests which can aquire(include/forward) a resource(alias) at request dispatcher is defined by multipling the FCAServerThreadCount (http service property) by the current property. Note that this property is meaningful only if the EnableQoSRestrictionsForRD (servlet_jsp service property) is switched on to true

property.name: DisableQoSStatisticsForWCERD
property.short_description: if true - quality of service will be used
property.description: Switches on/off qos restriction at request dispatcher
